alert.note: Alert for Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 12:02PM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Washington and Wilkinson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the woodlands and wetlands along the river upstream and downstream from a gage located by a dirt boat ramp on the west side of Avant Mine off Adams Road in Washington County. The water level will begin to surround the elevated USGS gage house. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 02/06/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
